result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Jeffrey A Knudson was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Commitment & Conditional Release

Atty Sattler requested competency evlauation be unsealed so it may be reveiwed by Corporation Counsel. Defn objected. Defn. agreed, as did Atty Rios, w/finding of Dr. Schoenecker that defn. is not competent and not likely to be restored to competency.  Atty Sattler did not contest finding of Dr. Schoenecker. Ct. found defn. was not competent and not likely to be restored to competency during statutory time limits.  Defns. would not stipulate to Chapter 51 commitment.  Ct. suspended all proceedings. Ct. released defn. from bond and its conditions and ordered cash bond be returned to the poster.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Susan K.
- Defendant shall not be at 898 County Hwy MM in Oregon, WI.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
